pull off.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to succeed in doing something difficult
pull off.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The goalkeeper pulled off six terrific saves.
pull off.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to drive a car off a road in order to stop, or to turn into a smaller road
pull off.translation[0].definitions[1].e: We pulled off the road to get some food.
pull off.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to succeed in doing something difficult
pull off.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Applix Inc. pulled off an exclusive $15 million deal with K K Ashisuto.
Cobra Beer has pulled off another coup at the awards in Brussels, winning 13 medals for its beers and wines.
